isis.stitle: TSI 97-12-12R - Release of 1996½ (Effective with Engine Serial Number 375549) and 1997 (Effective with Engine Serial Number 460195) Model Year Component Changes for the T 444E Engine.

subjectgroup.subject: Release of 1996½ (Effective with Engine Serial Number 375549) and 1997 (Effective with Engine Serial Number 460195) Model Year Component Changes for the T 444E Engine.

geninfo.para: This TSI incorporates information from Addendum No. 1.

Significant changes have been made to the T 444E engine effective with the 1996½ and 1997 model years. The major areas addressed are the crankcase, valve train, front cover, lubrication system, water pump, electronic controls and fuel system.

svcproc.title: Crankcase
svcproc.para: The crankcase has been redesigned with thicker valley walls to increase stiffness to the assembly which will reduce radiated engine combustion noise. The crankcase has also been modified in the tappet shelf area and has smaller diameter pushrod holes. Table 1 pairs the engine serial number with the crankcase assembly package for 1997, 1996½ and earlier model years.
Compare Figure 1, the 1996½ model year crankcase, to Figure 2, an earlier model.

table.title: Table 1 Engine Serial Number to Crankcase Assembly PKG by Model Year

svcproc.title: Valve Train
svcproc.para: The valve train has been redesigned to replace the cam follower guides and retainer ( Figure 3) with the new style cam follower guide assemblies ( Figure 4) which directly bolt into the crankcase to hold the follower in place. The new roller follower guide assemblies are now held in place with a capscrew for each pair of hydraulic lifters, which has led to eliminating the need for the roller follower guide retainer.

With the changes to the valve train and crankcase, the cylinder head gasket has been upgraded. The 1996½ model year head gasket has been redesigned to provide individual holes for each push rod which will guide the push rod into the hydraulic lifter seat.

The 1997 model year head gasket has been made thinner to increase the compression ratio which improves cold ambient performance. This new head gasket can be identified by its blue stripes in the top or up side. Figure 5 shows an earlier model year head gasket and the 1996½ model year head gasket.
Table 2: Serial Numbers and Part Numbers for Current and New Engines and Components.

table.title: Table 2: Serial Numbers and Part Numbers for Current and New Engines and Components

svcproc.title: Lubrication
svcproc.para: To ensure that oil is retained in the bottom of the pump for initial oil pump priming, the position of the oil pump inlet port has been rotated 90 degrees. Because of the inlet port rotation, the pickup tube and mounting location at the front cover have been rerouted to the right side of the engine. The oil pickup tube and gasket, bracket, and the pickup clearance passage (and baffles) in the oil pan were also revised to accommodate the right side oil inlet design. Figure 6 compares a 1996½ model year oil pan with the changes, and an earlier model year oil pan without them.

All models are also equipped with new oil level gauges and tube assemblies. The front oil cooler header mounting gasket has been modified slightly in the coolant sealing area as a result of front cover changes. Table 3 lists the Engine Serial Numbers and the Part numbers of current and new engines and components affected by the change.

entry.para: Front Oil Cooler Header Mounting Gasket

svcproc.title: Front Cover
svcproc.para: For the 1996½ model year, the new front cover assembly has been updated to include the pickup tube location change, oil pump inlet port vane rotation repositioning and removal of the drilled hole for the deaeration valve. The change also includes a new oil pickup tube gasket. For a contrast of the current and new front covers, view Figure 7.
For Front Cover Assembly and Front Cover Gasket Package see Table 4.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Front Cover Assembly - External View

entry.para: *Serial numbers 501 to 216543 (except serial numbers 213855 to 214133) use 1 820 509C91.
Serial numbers 216544 to 375548 (except serial numbers 213855 to 214133) use 1 824 537C93.

svcproc.title: WATER PUMP
ELECTRONIC SYSTEM
svcproc.para: To increase reliability, transducers and sensors, with their related wiring harness connectors, have been improved by using gold terminal pins rather than tin alloy. The revised wiring harnesses also have the gold terminal connections.
Those engines equipped with an exhaust back pressure system have a new injection control pressure (transducer), EBP sensor and engine coolant temperature sensor ( Table 6).

svcproc.title: FUEL SYSTEM (1997 MODEL YEAR)
svcproc.para: The fuel system has been improved for all 1997 model year engines by incorporating a dead-ended type fuel rail pressure damping system with split-shot type injectors ( Table 7). Both fuel rails incorporate a check valve ( Figure 9). The split-shot injector has been designed to provide two-stage injection which reduces combustion knock and oxide emissions at low idle and light load conditions ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Check Valves For 1997 Model Year
Figure 10. Right And Left Bank Fuel Tube For 1997 Model Year

table.title: T 444E Model Year Part Information (Including Front Cover Assembly)

entry.para: Front Oil Cooler Header Mounting Gasket
***Serial numbers 501 to 216543 (except serial numbers 213855 to 214133) use 1 820 509 C91.
Serial numbers 216544 to 375548 (except serial numbers 213855 to 214133) use 1 824 537 C93.
